title: Government Shutdown Could Delay Economic Data at a Critical Moment
summary: “Flying blind amidst heavy fog is a dangerous proposition,” one economist said about the risks of a lapse in official statistics.

summary: President Trump met with Republican and Democratic leaders at the White House, but they emerged without a deal, as Democrats seek more health care funding.

summary: Federal funding will lapse this week if Congress does not act. Areas across the government will be affected.

summary: Plus, how live betting is changing the world of sports.

title: U.S. Deports Planeload of Iranians After Deal With Tehran, Officials Say
summary: The deportation flight to Iran is the most stark push yet by the Trump administration to deport migrants even to places with harsh human rights records.

title: After Volatile Summer, Trump’s Approval Remains Low but Stable, Poll Finds
summary: A new Times/Siena survey shows the president retaining the support of nine out of 10 G.O.P. voters, even as the government races toward a shutdown on Wednesday.

title: Florida Plans to Hand Over Prime Miami Property for Trump Library
summary: President Trump has not revealed any concrete plans for a future library, but his son and others have been scouting possible sites in South Florida for months.

title: Memphis Braces for the National Guard
summary: Drained by years of crime and conservative criticism, Memphis is set to receive a wave of federal agents that residents are divided over.

title: With New U.S. Proposal to End Gaza War, a Rare Moment of Triumph for Netanyahu
summary: In President Trump’s plan, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu got almost everything he hoped for in the end, despite mounting international isolation.

title: Trump and Netanyahu Tell Hamas to Accept Gaza Cease-Fire Plan, Or Else
summary: President Trump said Israel would have a green light to “finish the job” if Hamas refused to agree to the cease-fire deal.

title: Trinity Church’s New Organ in Manhattan Is Shaking the Pews
summary: Trinity’s organ was destroyed in the Sept. 11 attacks. At last, its replacement has been unveiled. Hear the sound of its 8,041 pipes.

title: Trump Pardon Ended Probe Into Green Beret’s Killing of Suspected Taliban Bombmaker. Was Justice Served?
summary: The president’s pardon of Mathew Golsteyn cut short an investigation into his killing of a man he believed to be a Taliban bombmaker. Was justice served?

title: Inside the U.S. Special Forces: 5 Takeaways on a Culture of Lawlessness in Afghanistan
summary: Until now, many of the troubling events that took place during the war in Afghanistan have been shrouded in secrecy.

title: Michigan Church Attacker Is Said to Have Held a Grudge Against Mormons
summary: Several friends and acquaintances of the man accused of attacking a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints meetinghouse said he had long railed against the faith.

title: Eric Adams’s Campaign Is Over. His Campaign Finance Problems Are Not.
summary: City regulators are focusing on potential fund-raising irregularities that could result in the clawback of $10 million from Mr. Adams’s 2021 mayoral campaign.

title: Ukraine’s Troops Rely on a Secretive Ammunition Program. Now It’s in Doubt.
summary: A Czech Republic-led effort gathers munitions for Kyiv from around the world, but an opposition party expected to win elections there has vowed to drop it.

title: In-Game Sports Betting Is Growing. So Are the Concerns.
summary: In-game betting is predicted to grow to more than $14 billion by the end of the decade. It’s a huge part of the sports gambling industry. Public health officials worry that it could be increasing the risks for gamblers.

title: A 102-Year-Old Yoga Teacher’s Simple Approach to Aging Well
summary: For decades, Charlotte Chopin has been bending and stretching in Léré, a village in France. Here’s how she keeps moving.

title: Top A.I. Researchers Leave OpenAI, Google and Meta for New Start-Up
summary: Founded by a co-creator of ChatGPT, Periodic Labs aims to build artificial intelligence that can accelerate discoveries in physics, chemistry and other fields.

title: What We Know About ChatGPT’s New Parental Controls
summary: OpenAI said parents can set time and content limits on accounts and receive notifications if ChatGPT detects signs of potential self-harm.

title: Joseph Gordon-Levitt: Meta’s A.I. Chatbot Is Dangerous for Kids
summary: Mark Zuckerberg has a vision for how A.I. could be used in Meta’s universe. But the actor and filmmaker Joseph Gordon-Levitt is here to point out a flaw in the technology: an apparent lack of guardrails around how the company’s chatbot interacts with underage users.

title: Newt Gingrich: How to Win a Shutdown Fight
summary: It’s hard to come out a victor without a clear objective and a clear message.

title: What It Takes to Get Lunch Delivered to the 70th Floor
summary: An informal network of last-mile runners close the gap between harried delivery drivers and hungry office workers in a Shenzhen skyscraper.

title: Colombia’s President Reinforces Common Stereotype, Sparking Widespread Backlash
summary: An offhand comment by President Gustavo Petro of Colombia about men with a stigmatized first name has set off a backlash and broader discussions over classism.

title: Peace Broker, Arms Supplier: China’s Dual Roles in a Deadly Conflict
summary: China urged Cambodia and Thailand to end their border war in July. But weeks earlier, it had sent rockets and artillery shells to Cambodia, Thai intelligence documents show.

title: Lally Weymouth, Globe-Trotting Reporter and Scion of Graham Family, Dies at 82
summary: The daughter of Washington Post publisher Katharine Graham, she secured hard-to-land interviews with foreign leaders but found few opportunities for a leadership role.
